meanings.definition: Relating to an abbot or abbess.
meanings.sent1: The abbatial robes were worn by the wise abbot during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The abbatial duties included overseeing the monastery's daily activities.
meanings.sent3: The abbatial cat, named Abbie, enjoyed sitting on the abbot's lap during meetings.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was abbatial, commanding respect and admiration from all.
meanings.sent5: The abbatial presence of the abbot filled the room with a sense of peace and authority.

meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to an abbey.
meanings.sent1: The abbatial architecture of the building reflected its historical connection to the abbey.
meanings.sent2: Visitors were impressed by the abbatial beauty of the abbey's gardens.
meanings.sent3: The abbatial bells rang melodiously, echoing through the abbey's halls.
meanings.sent4: The abbatial silence of the abbey at night was both eerie and calming.
meanings.sent5: The abbatial atmosphere of the abbey transported visitors back in time to a bygone era.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of an abbot or abbess.
meanings.sent1: His demeanor was abbatial, exuding the same grace and wisdom as an abbot.
meanings.sent2: The abbatial staff he carried symbolized his authority within the monastery.
meanings.sent3: The abbatial portrait hanging in the hallway captured the essence of the beloved abbot.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an abbatial quality, commanding attention and respect.
meanings.sent5: The abbatial presence of the newcomer reminded the monks of their former abbot.
